greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sigma(n) - 1 for n such that sigma(n) - 1 is prime.
comment: a(n) = corresponding values of primes p = sigma(A248792(n)) - 1, where A248792(n) = numbers n such that sigma(n) - 1 is prime.
If there are at least two numbers k, h such that a(k) = a(h) = p, then p is in A158913.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
OEIS Wiki, Cyclotomic Polynomials at x=n, n! and sigma(n)
formula: If A248792(n) is a prime p, then a(n) = A248792(n) = p.
maple: if isprime(r) then r else NULL fi
mathematica: Cases[DivisorSigma[1, #] - 1 & /@ Range[n], _?PrimeQ]; a248793[104] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 07 2014 *)
program: (MAGMA) [a: n in [1..1000] | IsPrime(a) where a is SumOfDivisors(n)-1]
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Nov 01 2014
